meanings.definition: Having several different forms or types
meanings.sent1: The zoo displayed a polytypic collection of animals, including various species of birds and mammals.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery showcased a polytypic exhibit, featuring paintings, sculptures, and photographs.
meanings.sent3: It was quite polytypic to see the garden filled with a mix of colorful flowers and different types of vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a polytypic assortment of clothing styles, ranging from casual to formal.
meanings.sent5: The polytypic landscape of the national park offered a stunning view of mountains, forests, and lakes.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting variation in characteristics among individuals of the same species
meanings.sent1: The polytypic group of students had diverse interests, hobbies, and talents.
meanings.sent2: In the polytypic family of birds, each member had unique feather patterns and colors.
meanings.sent3: The polytypic party guests brought different dishes, creating a colorful and tasty buffet.
meanings.sent4: The polytypic personalities of the team members made collaboration interesting and dynamic.
meanings.sent5: The polytypic patterns on the butterfly wings mesmerized the observers with their beauty and variety.
